snippet: Washington should create a public employee pension reform program that serves as an insurance agency.
abstract: Op-Ed by former Los Angeles Mayor Richard J Riordan and journalist Tim Rutten urges Pres Obama to propose a public employee pension reform program so that other cities can avoid the fate of Detroit; details their plan, which would allows cities and perhaps states to sell bonds to cover their pension liabilities, with the federal government guaranteeing repayment.

byline.original: By RICHARD J. RIORDAN and TIM RUTTEN

lead_paragraph: Washington should create a public employee pension reform program that serves as an insurance agency.

headline.main: A Plan to Avert the Pension Crisis
headline.print_headline: A Plan to Avert the Pension Crisis
